### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employee_records (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name STRING,
  position STRING,
  department STRING
);


CREATE TABLE schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  date DATE,
  shift STRING,
  FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employee_records(employee_id)
);


CREATE TABLE plant_information (
  plant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location STRING,
  capacity INT,
  manager_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee_records(employee_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE employee_records SET position = 'Manager' WHERE employee_id = 101

### TABLEDATA

  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name STRING,

);


CREATE TABLE schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  date DATE,
  shift STRING,
  FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employee_records(employee_id)
);


CREATE TABLE plant_information (
  plant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location STRING,
  capacity INT,
  manager_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (manager_id) REFERENCES employee_records(employee_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE schedule SET shift = 'Evening' WHERE employee_id = 201 AND date = '2023-06-15'

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
   employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   name VARCHAR(255),
   job_title VARCHAR(255),
   department_id INT,
   hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE departments (
   department_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   department_name VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE schedules (
   schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   employee_id INT,
   shift_start_time TIME,
   shift_end_time TIME
)

CREATE TABLE projects (
   project_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   project_name VARCHAR(255),
   department_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE tasks (
   task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   task_description TEXT,
   project_id INT,
   deadline DATE
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE employees SET job_title = 'Manager' WHERE employee_id = 1;
